column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/4af4d2ea743ec08a2ffd652bf066f3f53d922571 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
As commented elsewhere, I would really prefer netbase to not be dependent on boost::asio.\n

Right, as I've already explained to @4tar that was also my rationale for making it a separate conversion function.

However `rpcserver.cpp` was also no longer the right place once it's used outside the RPC subsystem - for #4299.

But boost::asio doesn't solve the problem there either, so my vote goes to closing this one and #4299.
